title: First Winter Letter
text: The candle flickers in the dark. Your hands—calloused, young—hold a letter. The last words of the First Farmer.
The earth remembers. Every seed planted, every harvest taken. The machine-god sleeps beneath, but the soil holds our history.'
The letter is soil-stained. The ink has faded, but the words remain.
'Tend it well. Your bloodline is your legacy. Your choices echo through generations.'
You fold the letter carefully. Outside, the wind howls. Spring will come. The soil waits.
Your bloodline rises... or ends with you.
